intro: Lupinus valdepallidus, commonly known as the Valdepeñas lupine, is a flowering plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect growth habit and clusters of violet to pink flowers. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. Lupinus valdepallidus is adapted to grow in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and scrublands.
